abstract: A unique id that is stable for the duration of a generated response.
overview:
## Discussion

A [doc://com.apple.foundationmodels/documentation/FoundationModels/LanguageModelSession] produces instances of [doc://com.apple.foundationmodels/documentation/FoundationModels/GeneratedContent] that have a non-nil `id`. When you stream a response, the `id` is the same for all partial generations in the response stream.

Instances of [doc://com.apple.foundationmodels/documentation/FoundationModels/GeneratedContent] that you produce manually with initializers have a nil `id` because the framework didn’t create them as part of a generation.

# id

**Instance Property**

A unique id that is stable for the duration of a generated response.

## Declaration

```swift
var id: GenerationID?
```

## Discussion

A [doc://com.apple.foundationmodels/documentation/FoundationModels/LanguageModelSession] produces instances of [doc://com.apple.foundationmodels/documentation/FoundationModels/GeneratedContent] that have a non-nil `id`. When you stream a response, the `id` is the same for all partial generations in the response stream.

Instances of [doc://com.apple.foundationmodels/documentation/FoundationModels/GeneratedContent] that you produce manually with initializers have a nil `id` because the framework didn’t create them as part of a generation.
title: id
